title: Authors and Citation
text: Kassem J (2025). Homework6: Sparse Numeric Vector Class Operations. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/Janakass3m/Homework6.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Homework6: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations},   author = {Jana Kassem},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/Janakass3m/Homework6}, }

what: Homework6: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations
title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations
text: Homework6 package implements S4 class called sparse_numeric efficiently representing manipulating numeric vectors contain many zeros. package includes arithmetic operations, statistical methods, full documentation generated roxygen2, automated testing using testthat, pkgdown documentation website. package includes: Custom S4 class sparse_numeric Arithmetic methods (sparse_add, sparse_sub, sparse_mult) Cross-product, Euclidean norm, mean computations Standardization method works without converting dense format Full documentation generated roxygen2 Automated testing using testthat GitHub Actions continuous integration pkgdown documentation website package passes R CMD check 0 errors, 0 warnings, 0 notes.

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations
text: can install development version Homework6 like :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("JanaKassem/Homework6")

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations
text: class stores sparse vectors using: value: numeric vector non-zero entries pos: positions non-zero values length: total length full vector

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations
text: sparse_add(x, y) sparse_sub(x, y) sparse_mult(x, y) sparse_crossprod(x, y) mean(x) norm(x) standardize(x) (x, "numeric")

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(Homework6) #>  #> Attaching package: 'Homework6' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     norm ## basic example code x <- as(c(0, 2, 0, 4), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(1, 0, 3, 0), "sparse_numeric")  # Addition sparse_add(x, y) #> sparse_numeric(length = 4, nnz = 4) #>   pos  : 1 2 3 4 #>   value: 1 2 3 4  # Mean mean(x) #> [1] 1.5  # Norm norm(x) #> [1] 4.472136  # Standardize standardize(x) #> sparse_numeric(length = 4, nnz = 4) #>   pos  : 1 2 3 4 #>   value: -0.783349 0.261116 -0.783349 1.30558

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations
text: pkgdown documentation website available : https://JanaKassem.github.io/Homework6/

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Operations

what: Homework6: Sparse Numeric Vector Tools — Homework6-package
title: Homework6: Sparse Numeric Vector Tools — Homework6-package
text: Provides S4 class sparse numeric vectors basic operations arithmetic, norms, standardization without converting dense format.

title: Homework6: Sparse Numeric Vector Tools — Homework6-package
text: Maintainer: Jana Kassem jana.kassem@utexas.edu

what: Length of a sparse_numeric vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
title: Length of a sparse_numeric vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
text: Returns full length underlying vector, including zeros.

title: Length of a sparse_numeric vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' length(x)

title: Length of a sparse_numeric vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
text: x sparse_numeric object.

title: Length of a sparse_numeric vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
text: integer scalar giving vector length.

what: Mean of a sparse_numeric vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
title: Mean of a sparse_numeric vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
text: Computes mean sparse_numeric vector, treating missing entries zeros (.e., full length).

title: Mean of a sparse_numeric vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' mean(x, ...)

title: Mean of a sparse_numeric vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
text: x sparse_numeric object. ... Ignored.

title: Mean of a sparse_numeric vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
text: numeric scalar giving mean.

title: Mean of a sparse_numeric vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 2, 0), "sparse_numeric") mean(x) #> [1] 0.75

what: Euclidean norm of a sparse numeric vector — norm
title: Euclidean norm of a sparse numeric vector — norm
text: Computes Euclidean (L2) norm sparse_numeric vector: square root sum squared elements.

title: Euclidean norm of a sparse numeric vector — norm
code: norm(x)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' norm(x)

title: Euclidean norm of a sparse numeric vector — norm
text: x sparse_numeric vector.

title: Euclidean norm of a sparse numeric vector — norm
text: numeric scalar giving norm.

title: Euclidean norm of a sparse numeric vector — norm
code: x <- as(c(3, 0, 4), "sparse_numeric") norm(x) #> [1] 5

what: Plot overlapping non-zero entries of two sparse vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
title: Plot overlapping non-zero entries of two sparse vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
text: plot method sparse_numeric vectors. plots values two sparse vectors overlapping non-zero positions.

title: Plot overlapping non-zero entries of two sparse vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' plot(x, y, ...)

title: Plot overlapping non-zero entries of two sparse vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
text: x sparse_numeric vector. y sparse_numeric vector length. ... Additional arguments passed graphics::plot().

title: Display a sparse_numeric object — show,sparse_numeric-method
text: show method sparse_numeric prints length, number non-zero entries, first non-zero positions/values.

title: Display a sparse_numeric object — show,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' show(object)

title: Display a sparse_numeric object — show,sparse_numeric-method
text: object sparse_numeric object.

what: Add two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_add
title: Add two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_add
text: Element-wise addition two sparse_numeric vectors.

title: Add two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_add
code: sparse_add(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_add(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 + e2

title: Add two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_add
text: x sparse_numeric vector. y sparse_numeric vector length. e1 First sparse_numeric vector (operator methods). e2 Second sparse_numeric vector (operator methods).

title: Add two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_add
text: sparse_numeric vector containing element-wise sum.

title: Add two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_add
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 2), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 5, 0), "sparse_numeric") sparse_add(x, y) #> sparse_numeric(length = 3, nnz = 3) #>   pos  : 1 2 3 #>   value: 1 5 2

what: Crossproduct of two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_crossprod
title: Crossproduct of two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_crossprod
text: Computes dot product two sparse_numeric vectors.

title: Crossproduct of two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_crossprod
code: sparse_crossprod(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_crossprod(x, y)

title: Crossproduct of two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_crossprod
text: x sparse_numeric vector. y sparse_numeric vector length.

title: Crossproduct of two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_crossprod
text: numeric scalar equal sum(x * y).

title: Crossproduct of two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_crossprod
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 2), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 5, 3), "sparse_numeric") sparse_crossprod(x, y) #> [1] 6

what: Multiply two sparse numeric vectors element-wise — sparse_mult
title: Multiply two sparse numeric vectors element-wise — sparse_mult
text: Element-wise multiplication two sparse_numeric vectors.

title: Multiply two sparse numeric vectors element-wise — sparse_mult
code: sparse_mult(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_mult(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 * e2

title: Multiply two sparse numeric vectors element-wise — sparse_mult
text: x sparse_numeric vector. y sparse_numeric vector length. e1 First sparse_numeric vector (operator methods). e2 Second sparse_numeric vector (operator methods).

title: Multiply two sparse numeric vectors element-wise — sparse_mult
text: sparse_numeric vector containing element-wise product.

title: Multiply two sparse numeric vectors element-wise — sparse_mult
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 2), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 5, 3), "sparse_numeric") sparse_mult(x, y) #> sparse_numeric(length = 3, nnz = 1) #>   pos  : 3 #>   value: 6

title: Sparse numeric vector class — sparse_numeric-class
text: S4 class storing numeric vectors sparse format. non-zero entries stored, together positions full vector length.

title: Sparse numeric vector class — sparse_numeric-class
text: value Numeric vector non-zero values. pos Integer vector 1-based positions non-zero values. length Integer scalar giving total length vector (including zeros).

what: Subtract two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_sub
title: Subtract two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_sub
text: Element-wise subtraction two sparse_numeric vectors.

title: Subtract two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_sub
code: sparse_sub(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_sub(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 - e2

title: Subtract two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_sub
text: x sparse_numeric vector. y sparse_numeric vector length. e1 First sparse_numeric vector (operator methods). e2 Second sparse_numeric vector (operator methods).

title: Subtract two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_sub
text: sparse_numeric vector containing x - y.

title: Subtract two sparse numeric vectors — sparse_sub
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 2), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 5, 1), "sparse_numeric") sparse_sub(x, y) #> sparse_numeric(length = 3, nnz = 3) #>   pos  : 1 2 3 #>   value: 1 -5 1

what: Standardize a sparse numeric vector — standardize
title: Standardize a sparse numeric vector — standardize
text: Standardizes sparse_numeric vector subtracting mean (computed entries including zeros) dividing sample standard deviation (also entries).

title: Standardize a sparse numeric vector — standardize
code: standardize(x)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' standardize(x)

title: Standardize a sparse numeric vector — standardize
text: x sparse_numeric vector.

title: Standardize a sparse numeric vector — standardize
text: standardized sparse_numeric vector (approximately) mean 0 standard deviation 1 converted dense form.

title: Standardize a sparse numeric vector — standardize
